item.title: Bloomberg Promises $15 Million To Help Make Up For U.S. Withdrawal From Climate Deal
item.description: June 2, 2017 - "Americans will honor and fulfill the Paris Agreement by leading from the bottom up — and there isn't anything Washington can do to stop us," Michael Bloomberg said.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 2, 2017 - "Americans will honor and fulfill the Paris Agreement by leading from the bottom up — and there isn't anything Washington can do to stop us," Michael Bloomberg said. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/02/531238185/bloomberg-promises-15-million-to-help-make-up-for-u-s-withdrawal-from-climate-de

item.title: Many COPD Patients Struggle To Pay For Each Breath
item.description: June 2, 2017 - One in 9 Medicare enrollees have chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, and many of them can't afford the inhalers that keep them out of the emergency room.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 2, 2017 - One in 9 Medicare enrollees have chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, and many of them can't afford the inhalers that keep them out of the emergency room. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/02/529759280/many-copd-patients-struggle-to-pay-for-each-breath

item.title: The Role Of Yoga In Healing Trauma
item.description:
June 2, 2017 - So-called 'trauma-aware yoga' has mind and body benefits, says Georgetown research.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/ed/2017/06/02/527570310/the-role-of-yoga-in-healing-trauma
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 2, 2017 - So-called 'trauma-aware yoga' has mind and body benefits, says Georgetown research. http://www.npr.org/sections/ed/2017/06/02/527570310/the-role-of-yoga-in-healing-trauma

item.title: Why Recycling Options Lead People To Waste More
item.description: June 2, 2017 - People used more cups and paper when recycling was an option versus when they had to put them in the trash. Researchers say people's guilt for wasting is overridden by the good feelings for recycling.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 2, 2017 - People used more cups and paper when recycling was an option versus when they had to put them in the trash. Researchers say people's guilt for wasting is overridden by the good feelings for recycling. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/02/531173499/why-recycling-options-lead-people-to-waste-more

item.title: Trump's Speech On Paris Climate Agreement Withdrawal, Annotated
item.description: June 1, 2017 - NPR journalists have fact-checked and analyzed the president's announcement that the U.S. will pull out of the international accord, including Trump's comments on terrorism and the economy.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 1, 2017 - NPR journalists have fact-checked and analyzed the president's announcement that the U.S. will pull out of the international accord, including Trump's comments on terrorism and the economy. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/01/531090243/trumps-speech-on-paris-climate-agreement-withdrawal-annotated

item.title: Mars Incorporated Criticizes Trump's Decision To Leave Paris Climate Accord
item.description: June 1, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks to Andy Pharoah, vice president for corporate affairs at Mars Incorporated, about why the company is such an avid backer of the Paris Climate Agreement.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 1, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks to Andy Pharoah, vice president for corporate affairs at Mars Incorporated, about why the company is such an avid backer of the Paris Climate Agreement. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/01/531099035/mars-incorporated-criticizes-trumps-decision-to-leave-paris-climate-accord

item.title: Using Music And Rhythm To Help Kids With Grammar And Language
item.description: June 1, 2017 - Researchers at Vanderbilt University Medical Center are studying how music and rhythm activities could help children who struggle with grammar and language development.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 1, 2017 - Researchers at Vanderbilt University Medical Center are studying how music and rhythm activities could help children who struggle with grammar and language development. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/01/530723046/using-music-and-rhythm-to-help-kids-with-grammar-and-language

item.title: Montana Town Exemplifies Coal Country's Uncertain Future
item.description: June 1, 2017 - The Trump administration has declared an end to the "war on coal," but Colstrip, Mont., is still feeling besieged. The town is a good example of how complicated the future is for coal country.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 1, 2017 - The Trump administration has declared an end to the "war on coal," but Colstrip, Mont., is still feeling besieged. The town is a good example of how complicated the future is for coal country. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/01/531099076/montana-town-exemplifies-coal-countrys-uncertain-future

item.title: U.S. Intelligence Warns Against Security Implications Of Leaving Paris Accord
item.description: June 1, 2017 - U.S. intelligence experts warn that climate change can produce political instability, as crop failures, drought and rising sea levels prompt population shifts.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 1, 2017 - U.S. intelligence experts warn that climate change can produce political instability, as crop failures, drought and rising sea levels prompt population shifts. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/01/531099069/u-s-intelligence-warns-against-security-implications-of-leaving-paris-accord

item.title: President Trump Decides To Remove U.S. From Paris Climate Accord
item.description: June 1, 2017 - President Trump announced his decision on Thursday for the U.S. to leave the Paris climate accord. The decision is likely to have environmental and international implications.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 1, 2017 - President Trump announced his decision on Thursday for the U.S. to leave the Paris climate accord. The decision is likely to have environmental and international implications. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/01/531099023/president-trump-decides-to-remove-u-s-from-paris-climate-accord

item.title: California State Senator Doubles Down On Efforts To Fight Climate Change
item.description: June 1, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks with California's Senate President pro Tempore Kevin de Leon about his reactions to Trump's decision on the Paris climate accord. The Democrat has worked on legislation that would insulate California from federal environmental rollbacks.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 1, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks with California's Senate President pro Tempore Kevin de Leon about his reactions to Trump's decision on the Paris climate accord. The Democrat has worked on legislation that would insulate California from federal environmental rollbacks. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/01/531099009/california-state-senator-doubles-down-on-efforts-to-fight-climate-change

item.title: China Steps Forward As Unlikely Leader In Fight Against Climate Change
item.description: June 1, 2017 - NPR's Kelly McEvers talks with Robert Daly of the Kissinger Institute on China and the United States at the Woodrow Wilson Center about China's new commitment to green energy and fighting climate change.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 1, 2017 - NPR's Kelly McEvers talks with Robert Daly of the Kissinger Institute on China and the United States at the Woodrow Wilson Center about China's new commitment to green energy and fighting climate change. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/01/531099002/china-steps-forward-as-unlikely-leader-in-fight-against-climate-change

item.title: President Trump Decides To Pull U.S. Out Of Paris Climate Agreement
item.description: June 1, 2017 - President Trump announced Thursday the U.S. will leave the Paris agreement. The decision is likely to have a big impact on both the climate and environmental policy around the world.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 1, 2017 - President Trump announced Thursday the U.S. will leave the Paris agreement. The decision is likely to have a big impact on both the climate and environmental policy around the world. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/01/531098995/president-trump-decides-to-pull-u-s-out-of-paris-climate-agreement

item.title: Cracking The Code That Lets The Brain ID Any Face, Fast
item.description: June 1, 2017 - People and other primates have an amazing ability to instantly recognize faces. Scientists at Caltech found that we do that by having 205 specialized brain cells divvy up the task.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 1, 2017 - People and other primates have an amazing ability to instantly recognize faces. Scientists at Caltech found that we do that by having 205 specialized brain cells divvy up the task. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/01/530925382/cracking-the-code-that-lets-the-brain-id-any-face-fast

item.title: Citizen Scientists Comb Images To Find An 'Overexcited Planet'
item.description: June 1, 2017 - In a crowdsourced search for celestial objects, four volunteers helped scientists identify a brown dwarf by studying images taken over the years by a NASA satellite.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 1, 2017 - In a crowdsourced search for celestial objects, four volunteers helped scientists identify a brown dwarf by studying images taken over the years by a NASA satellite. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/01/530766624/citizen-scientists-comb-images-to-find-an-overexcited-planet
